classitems.description:
Stores the list of {{#crossLink "Skylink/once:method"}}once(){{/crossLink}}
  event subscription handlers.
classitems.name: _onceEvents

params.name: (#eventName)

props.name: (#index)
props.description: The event subscription handler associated with the event name. This is to be triggered once when condition is met. Alternatively, the once() event subscription handler can be unsubscribed with {{#crossLink "Skylink/off:method"}}off(){{/crossLink}} before condition is met.

classitems.description:
The throttling function datetime stamp in
  [(ISO 8601 format)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601).
classitems.name: _timestamp
_trigger

params.name: eventName
params.description: The Skylink event name to trigger that would trigger event subscription handlers associated to the event name with the arguments parameters payload.

classitems.description:
Subscribes an event handler associated to the event name.
This event handler will always be triggered when the event name is triggered. If you
  are looking for subscription event handler to be triggered once, check out
  {{#crossLink "Skylink/once:method"}}once() event subscription{{/crossLink}}.
classitems.name: on

params.name: eventName
params.description: The Skylink event name to subscribe to.

params.name: callback
params.description:
The event handler to subsribe to the associated
  Skylink event name that would be triggered once the event name is triggered.

classitems.description:
Subscribes an event handler associated to the event name that
   would only be triggered once the provided condition function has been met.
classitems.name: once

params.name: eventName
params.description: The Skylink event name to subscribe to.

params.name: callback
params.description: The event handler to subscribe to the associated Skylink event name to trigger once the condition has met. If fireAlways option is set toe true, this will always be fired when condition is met.

params.name: condition
params.description: The condition function that once the condition has been met, trigger the event handler once. Return in the condition function true to pass as meeting the condition. If the condition function is not provided, the event handler will be triggered once the Skylink event name is triggered.

params.name: fireAlways
params.description: The flag that indicates if Skylink should interrupt this once() function once the function has been triggered to not unsubscribe the event handler but to always trigger when the condition has been met.

classitems.description: Unsubscribes an event handler associated to the event name.
classitems.name: off

params.name: eventName
params.description: The Skylink event name to unsubscribe to.

params.name: callback
params.description:
The event handler to unsubscribe to the associated
  Skylink event name. If the event handler is not provided, Skylink would
  unsubscribe all event handlers subscribed to the associated event name.

classitems.description: Checks if the first condition is already met before doing an event handler subscription to wait for the second condition to be met. This method will do a event subscription with {{#crossLink "Skylink/once:method"}}once(){{/crossLink}} as this _condition() would only trigger once, unless fireAlways is set to true.
classitems.name: _condition

params.name: eventName
params.description: The Skylink event name to subscribe to.

params.name: callback
params.description: The event handler to subscribe to the associated Skylink event name to trigger once the condition has met. If fireAlways option is set to true, this will always be fired when condition is met.

params.name: checkFirst
params.description: The first condition to check before doing an event subscription to wait for second condition to meet. Return in the first condition function true to pass as meeting the condition. If the first condition is met, the event handler would be triggered and the event handler will not be subscribed to the event or wait for second condition to pass.

params.name: condition
params.description: The second condition function that once the it has been met, it will trigger the event handler once. Return in the second condition function true to pass as meeting the condition. If the second condition is met, the event handler would be triggered and depending if fireAlways option is set to true, this will always be fired when condition is met.

params.name: fireAlways
params.description:
The flag that indicates if Skylink should interrupt the
  second condition function once the function has been triggered to not unsubscribe the
  event handler but to always trigger when the second condition has been met.

classitems.description: Starts the interval check for the condition provided to meet before clearing the interval and triggering the callback provided. This utilises setInterval() function.
classitems.name: _wait

params.name: callback
params.description:
The callback fired after the condition provided
  has been met.

params.name: condition
params.description: The condition function that once the condition has been met, trigger the callback. Return in the condition function true to pass as meeting the condition.

params.name: intervalTime
params.description: The interval loop timeout that the interval check should iterate based on the timeout provided (in ms). By default, if the value is not configured, it is 50ms.

classitems.description:
Returns a wrapper of the original function, which fires only once during
 a specified amount of time.
classitems.name: _throttle

params.name: func
params.description: The function that should be throttled.

params.name: wait
params.description: The amount of time that function need to throttled (in ms).

return.description: The throttled function.

classitems.description:
These are the list of socket connection error states that Skylink would trigger.
- These error states references the [socket.io-client events](http://socket.io/docs/client-api/).
classitems.name: SOCKET_ERROR

params.name: CONNECTION_FAILED
params.description: Value 0 The error state when Skylink have failed to establish a socket connection with platform signaling in the first attempt.

params.name: RECONNECTION_FAILED
params.description: Value -1 The error state when Skylink have failed to reestablish a socket connection with platform signaling after the first attempt CONNECTION_FAILED.

params.name: CONNECTION_ABORTED
params.description: Value -2 The error state when attempt to reestablish socket connection with platform signaling has been aborted after the failed first attempt CONNECTION_FAILED.

params.name: RECONNECTION_ABORTED
params.description: Value -3 The error state when attempt to reestablish socket connection with platform signaling has been aborted after several failed reattempts RECONNECTION_FAILED.

params.name: RECONNECTION_ATTEMPT
params.description: Value -4 The error state when Skylink is attempting to reestablish a socket connection with platform signaling after a failed attempt CONNECTION_FAILED or RECONNECTION_FAILED.

classitems.description:
Stores the queued socket messages to sent to the platform signaling to
  prevent messages from being dropped due to messages being sent in
  less than a second interval.
classitems.name: _socketMessageQueue

classitems.description: Limits the socket messages being sent in less than a second interval using the setTimeout object to prevent messages being sent in less than a second interval. The messaegs are stored in {{#crossLink "Skylink/_socketMessageQueue:attribute"}}_socketMessageQueue{{/crossLink}}.
classitems.name: _socketMessageTimeout

classitems.description:
Stores the list of fallback ports that Skylink can attempt
  to establish a socket connection with platform signaling.
classitems.name: _socketPorts

params.name: http://
params.description: The array of HTTP protocol fallback ports. By default, the ports are [80, 3000].

params.name: https://
params.description: The The array of HTTP protocol fallback ports. By default, the ports are [443, 3443].

classitems.description: These are the list of fallback attempt types that Skylink would attempt with.
classitems.name: SOCKET_FALLBACK

params.name: NON_FALLBACK
params.description: Value "nonfallback" | Protocol "http:", "https:" | Transports "WebSocket", "Polling" The current socket connection attempt is using the first selected socket connection port for the current selected transport "Polling" or "WebSocket".

params.name: FALLBACK_PORT
params.description: Value "fallbackPortNonSSL" | Protocol "http:" | Transports "WebSocket" The current socket connection reattempt is using the next selected socket connection port for HTTP protocol connection with the current selected transport "Polling" or "WebSocket".

params.name: FALLBACK_PORT_SSL
params.description: Value "fallbackPortSSL" | Protocol "https:" | Transports "WebSocket" The current socket connection reattempt is using the next selected socket connection port for HTTPS protocol connection with the current selected transport "Polling" or "WebSocket".

params.name: LONG_POLLING
params.description: Value "fallbackLongPollingNonSSL" | Protocol "http:" | Transports "Polling" The current socket connection reattempt is using the next selected socket connection port for HTTP protocol connection with "Polling" after many attempts of "WebSocket" has failed. This occurs only for socket connection that is originally using "WebSocket" transports.

params.name: LONG_POLLING_SSL
params.description: Value "fallbackLongPollingSSL" | Protocol "https:" | Transports "Polling" The current socket connection reattempt is using the next selected socket connection port for HTTPS protocol connection with "Polling" after many attempts of "WebSocket" has failed. This occurs only for socket connection that is originally using "WebSocket" transports.

classitems.description:
The flag that indicates if the current socket connection with
  platform signaling is opened.
classitems.name: _channelOpen

classitems.description: Stores the platform signaling endpoint URI to open socket connection with.
classitems.name: _signalingServer

classitems.description: Stores the current platform signaling protocol to open socket connection with.
classitems.name: _signalingServerProtocol

classitems.description: Stores the current platform signaling port to open socket connection with.
classitems.name: _signalingServerPort

classitems.description: Stores the [socket.io-client io object](http://socket.io/docs/client-api/) that handles the middleware socket connection with platform signaling.
classitems.name: _socket

classitems.description: Stores the timeout (in ms) set to await in seconds for response from platform signaling before throwing a connection timeout exception when Skylink is attemtping to establish a connection with platform signaling. If the value is 0, it will use the default timeout from socket.io-client that is in 20000.
classitems.name: _socketTimeout

classitems.description: The flag that indicates if the current socket connection for transports types with "Polling" uses [XDomainRequest](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/cc288060(v=vs.85).aspx) instead of [XMLHttpRequest](http://www.w3schools.com/Xml/dom_httprequest.asp) due to the IE 8 / 9 XMLHttpRequest not supporting CORS access.
classitems.name: _socketUseXDR

classitems.description: Sends socket message over the platform signaling socket connection.
classitems.name: _sendChannelMessage

params.name: message
params.description: The socket message object.

props.name: type
props.description: Required. Protocol type of the socket message object.

classitems.description: Starts a socket.io connection with the platform signaling.
classitems.name: _createSocket

params.name: type
params.description:
The transport type of socket.io connection to use.
  • "WebSocket": Uses the WebSocket connection.
    options.transports = ["websocket"]
  • "Polling": Uses the Polling connection.
    options.transports = ["xhr-polling", "jsonp-polling", "polling"]

classitems.description:
Connects to the socket connection endpoint URI to platform signaling that is constructed with {{#crossLink "Skylink/_signalingServerProtocol:attribute"}}_signalingServerProtocol{{/crossLink}}, {{#crossLink "Skylink/_signalingServer:attribute"}}_signalingServer{{/crossLink}} and {{#crossLink "Skylink/_signalingServerPort:attribute"}}_signalingServerPort{{/crossLink}}. Example format: protocol//serverUrl:port.
Once URI is formed, it will start a new socket.io connection with {{#crossLink "Skylink/_createSocket:method"}}_createSocket(){{/crossLink}}.
classitems.name: _openChannel

classitems.description: Disconnects the current socket connection with the platform signaling.
classitems.name: _closeChannel

classitems.description:
The current version of the internal Signaling Message (SM) Protocol that Skylink is using.
- This is not a feature for developers to use but rather for SDK developers to see the Protocol version used in this Skylink version. - In some cases, this information may be used for reporting issues with Skylink. - SM_PROTOCOL VERSION: 0.1..
classitems.name: SM_PROTOCOL_VERSION

classitems.description:
The list of Protocol types that is used for messaging using
  the platform signaling socket connection.
classitems.name: _SIG_MESSAGE_TYPE

params.name: JOIN_ROOM
params.description:
Protocol sent from Skylink to platform signaling to let
   self join the room. Join room Step 1.

params.name: IN_ROOM
params.description:
Protocol received from platform signaling to inform
   Skylink that self has joined the room. Join room Step 2 (Completed).

params.name: ENTER
params.description:
Protocol Skylink sends to all Peer peers
   in the room to start handshake connection. Handshake connection Step 1.

params.name: WELCOME
params.description: Protocol received to Peer as a response to self ENTER message. This is sent as a response to Peer ENTER message. Handshake connection Step 2.

params.name: OFFER
params.description: Protocol sent to Peer as a response to the WELCOME message received after generating the offer session description with RTCPeerConnection.createOffer(). This is received as a response from Peer after sending WELCOME message and requires setting into the Peer connection before sending the ANSWER response. Handshake connection Step 3.

params.name: ANSWER
params.description: Protocol received from Peer as a response to self OFFER message offer session description and requires setting into the Peer connection. This is sent to Peer as a response to the OFFER message received after setting the received OFFER message and generating the answer session description with RTCPeerConnection.createAnswer(). Handshake connection Step 4 (Completed).

params.name: CANDIDATE
params.description:
Protocol received from Peer when connection
   ICE candidate has been generated and requires self to add to the Peer connection.

params.name: BYE
params.description:
Protocol received from platform signaling when a Peer has left
   the room.

params.name: REDIRECT
params.description:
Protocol received from platform signaling when self is kicked out from
   the currently joined room.

params.name: UPDATE_USER
params.description:
Protocol received when a Peer information has been
   updated. The message object should contain the updated peer information.
   This is broadcasted by self when self peer information is updated.

params.name: ROOM_LOCK
params.description:
Protocol received when the current joined room lock status have
   been updated. The message object should contain the updated room lock status.
   This is broadcasted by self when self updates the room lock status.

params.name: MUTE_VIDEO
params.description:
Protocol received when a Peer Stream video media streaming
   muted status have been updated. The message object should contain the updated Stream video media
   streaming muted status. This is broadcasted by self when self Stream video media streaming
   muted status have been updated.

params.name: MUTE_AUDIO
params.description:
Protocol received when a Peer connection Stream audio media streaming
   muted status have been updated. The message object should contain the updated Stream audio media
   streaming muted status. This is broadcasted by self when self Stream audio media streaming
   muted status have been updated.

params.name: PUBLIC_MESSAGE
params.description:
Protocol received when a Peer broadcasts a message
   object to all Peer peers via the platform signaling socket connection.
   This is broadcasted by self when self sends the message object.

params.name: PRIVATE_MESSAGE
params.description:
Protocol received when a Peer sends a message
   object targeted to several Peer peers via the platform signaling socket connection.
   This is sent by self when self sends the message object.

params.name: RESTART
params.description: Protocol received when a Peer connection requires a reconnection. At this point, the Peer connection have to recreate the RTCPeerConnection object again. This is sent by self when self initiates the reconnection.

params.name: STREAM
params.description:
Protocol received when a Peer connection Stream status have
   changed.

params.name: GET_PEERS
params.description:
Protocol for privileged self to get the list of Peer peers
   under the same parent Application Key.

params.name: PEER_LIST
params.description: Protocol to retrieve a list of peers under the same parent.

params.name: INTRODUCE
params.description:
Protocol sent to the platform signaling to
   introduce Peer peers to each other.

params.name: INTRODUCE_ERROR
params.description: Protocol received when Peer peers introduction failed.

params.name: APPROACH
params.description: Protocol to indicate that a Peer has been introduced. At this point, self would send an ENTER to introduced Peer to start the handshake connection.

params.name: GROUP
params.description: Protocol received that bundles messages together when socket messages are sent less than 1 second interval apart from the previous sent socket message. This would prevent receiving REDIRECT from the platform signaling.

classitems.name: _enterHandler

params.name: message
params.description: The message object received from platform signaling. This should contain the ENTER payload.

props.name: rid
props.description: The room ID for identification to the platform signaling connection.

props.name: mid
props.description: The Peer ID associated with this message.

props.name: receiveOnly
props.description:
The flag that indicates if the Peer
  connection would send Stream or not (receive only).

props.name: userInfo
props.description:
The peer information associated
  with the Peer Connection.

props.name: userData
props.description: The custom user data information set by developer. This custom user data can also be set in setUserData().

props.name: settings
props.description: The Peer Stream streaming settings information. If both audio and video option is false, there should be no receiving remote Stream object from this associated Peer.

props.name: settings.audio
props.description: The Peer Stream streaming audio settings. If false, it means that audio streaming is disabled in the remote Stream of the Peer.

props.name: settings.audio.stereo
props.description:
The flag that indicates if
  stereo should be enabled in the Peer connection Stream
  audio streaming.

props.name: settings.video
props.description: The Peer Stream streaming video settings. If false, it means that video streaming is disabled in the remote Stream of the Peer.

props.name: settings.video.resolution
props.description:
The Peer
  Stream streaming video resolution settings. Setting the resolution may
  not force set the resolution provided as it depends on the how the
  browser handles the resolution. [Rel: Skylink.VIDEO_RESOLUTION]

props.name: settings.video.resolution.width
props.description:
The Peer
  Stream streaming video resolution width.

props.name: settings.video.resolution.height
props.description:
The Peer
  Stream streaming video resolution height.

props.name: settings.video.frameRate
props.description:
The Peer
  Stream streaming video maximum frameRate.

props.name: settings.video.screenshare
props.description:
The flag
  that indicates if the Peer connection Stream object sent
  is a screensharing stream or not.

props.name: settings.bandwidth
props.description:
The Peer
  streaming bandwidth settings. Setting the bandwidth flags may not
  force set the bandwidth for each connection stream channels as it depends
  on how the browser handles the bandwidth bitrate. Values are configured
  in <var>kb/s</var>.

props.name: settings.bandwidth.audio
props.description:
The configured
  audio stream channel for the remote Stream object bandwidth
  that audio streaming should use in <var>kb/s</var>.

props.name: settings.bandwidth.video
props.description:
The configured
  video stream channel for the remote Stream object bandwidth
  that video streaming should use in <var>kb/s</var>.

props.name: settings.bandwidth.data
props.description:
The configured
  datachannel channel for the DataChannel connection bandwidth
  that datachannel connection per packet should be able use in <var>kb/s</var>.

props.name: mediaStatus
props.description:
The Peer Stream mute
  settings for both audio and video streamings.

props.name: mediaStatus.audioMuted
props.description: The flag that indicates if the remote Stream object audio streaming is muted. If there is no audio streaming enabled for the Peer, by default, it is set to true.

props.name: mediaStatus.videoMuted
props.description: The flag that indicates if the remote Stream object video streaming is muted. If there is no video streaming enabled for the Peer, by default, it is set to true.

props.name: agent.name
props.description: The Peer platform browser or agent name.

props.name: version
props.description: The Peer platform browser or agent version.

props.name: os
props.description: The Peer platform name.

props.name: sessionType
props.description: The Peer connection remote Stream streaming session type. If value is "stream", the Stream streaming session is normal user media streaming, else if it is "screensharing", the Stream streaming session is screensharing session.

props.name: type
props.description: Protocol step "enter".

To send message objects with DataChannel connections, see
  {{#crossLink "Skylink/sendP2PMessage:method"}}sendP2PMessage(){{/crossLink}}.
classitems.name: sendMessage

params.name: message
params.description: The message object.

params.name: targetPeerId
params.description:
The array of targeted PeerConnections to
  transfer the message object to. Alternatively, you may provide this parameter
  as a string to a specific targeted Peer to transfer the message object.

classitems.description: These are the list of available video codecs settings that Skylink would use when streaming video stream with Peers. - The video codec would be used if the self and Peer's browser supports the selected codec. - This would default to the browser selected codec. In most cases, option VP8 is used by default.
classitems.name: VIDEO_CODEC

params.name: AUTO
params.description: DEFAULT | Value "auto" The option to let Skylink use any video codec selected by the browser generated session description.

params.name: VP8
params.description:
Value "VP8" The option to let Skylink use the [VP8](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/VP8) codec.
This is the common and mandantory video codec used by most browsers.

params.name: H264
params.description:
Value "H264" The option to let Skylink use the [H264](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/H.264/MPEG-4_AVC) codec.
This only works if the browser supports the H264 video codec.

classitems.description: These are the list of available audio codecs settings that Skylink would use when streaming audio stream with Peers. - The audio codec would be used if the self and Peer's browser supports the selected codec. - This would default to the browser selected codec. In most cases, option OPUS is used by default.
classitems.name: AUDIO_CODEC

params.name: AUTO
params.description: DEFAULT | Value "auto" The option to let Skylink use any audio codec selected by the browser generated session description.

params.name: OPUS
params.description:
Value "opus" The option to let Skylink use the [OPUS](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Opus_(audio_format)) codec.
This is the common and mandantory audio codec used.

params.name: ISAC
params.description:
Value "ISAC" The option to let Skylink use the [iSAC](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Internet_Speech_Audio_Codec).
This only works if the browser supports the iSAC video codec.

classitems.description: Stores the preferred Peer connection streaming audio codec.
classitems.name: _selectedAudioCodec

classitems.description: Stores the preferred Peer connection streaming video codec.
classitems.name: _selectedVideoCodec

classitems.description: These are the list of suggested video resolutions that Skylink should configure when retrieving self user media video stream. - Setting the resolution may not force set the resolution provided as it depends on the how the browser handles the resolution. - It's recommended to use video resolution option to maximum FHD, as the other resolution options may be unrealistic and create performance issues. However, we provide them to allow developers to test with the browser capability, but do use it at your own risk. - The higher the resolution, the more CPU usage might be used, hence it's recommended to use the default option VGA. - This follows the [Wikipedia Graphics display resolution page](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Graphics_display_resolution#Video_Graphics_Array)

  video stream channel for the self Stream object bandwidth
  that video streaming should use in <var>kb/s</var>.

props.name: data
props.description:
The configured
  datachannel channel for the DataChannel connection bandwidth
  that datachannel connection per packet should be able use in <var>kb/s</var>.

classitems.description:
Gets self user media Stream object to attach to Skylink.
Do not invoke this function when user has already joined a room as
  this may affect any currently attached stream. You may use
 {{#crossLink "Skylink/sendStream:method"}}sendStream(){{/crossLink}}
 instead if self is already in the room, and allows application to
 attach application own MediaStream object to Skylink.
classitems.name: getUserMedia

params.name: options
params.description: The self Stream streaming settings for the new Stream object attached to Skylink. If this parameter is not provided, the options value would be { audio: true, video: true }.

props.name: audio
props.description: The self Stream streaming audio settings. If false, it means that audio streaming is disabled in the self Stream. If this option is set to true or is defined with settings, {{#crossLink "Skylink/getUserMedia:method"}}getUserMedia(){{/crossLink}} will be invoked. Self will not connect to the room unless the Stream audio user media access is given.

props.name: stereo
props.description:
The flag that indicates if
  stereo should be enabled in self connection Stream
  audio streaming.

props.name: mute
props.description:
The flag that
  indicates if the self Stream object audio streaming is muted.

props.name: optional
props.description: The optional constraints for audio streaming in self user media Stream object. This follows the optional setting in the MediaStreamConstraints when getUserMedia() is invoked. Tampering this may cause errors in retrieval of self user media Stream object. Refer to this [site for more reference](http://www.sitepoint.com/introduction-getusermedia-api/).

props.name: video
props.description: The self Stream streaming video settings. If false, it means that video streaming is disabled in the self Stream. If this option is set to true or is defined with settings, {{#crossLink "Skylink/getUserMedia:method"}}getUserMedia(){{/crossLink}} will be invoked. Self will not connect to the room unless the Stream video user media access is given.

props.name: mute
props.description:
The flag that
  indicates if the self Stream object video streaming is muted.

props.name: resolution
props.description:
The self Stream streaming video
  resolution settings. Setting the resolution may
  not force set the resolution provided as it depends on the how the
  browser handles the resolution. [Rel: Skylink.VIDEO_RESOLUTION]

props.name: resolution.width
props.description: The self Stream streaming video resolution width. This sets the maxWidth of the video constraints passed in getUserMedia().

props.name: resolution.height
props.description: The self Stream streaming video resolution height. This sets the maxHeight of the video constraints passed in getUserMedia().

props.name: frameRate
props.description: The self Stream streaming video maximum frameRate. This sets the maxFramerate of the video constraints passed in getUserMedia().

props.name: optional
props.description: The optional constraints for video streaming in self user media Stream object. This follows the optional setting in the MediaStreamConstraints when getUserMedia() is invoked. Tampering this may cause errors in retrieval of self user media Stream object. Refer to this [site for more reference](http://www.sitepoint.com/introduction-getusermedia-api/).

params.name: callback
params.description: The callback fired after Skylink has gained access to self media stream and attached it successfully with the provided media settings or have met with an exception. The callback signature is function (error, success).

props.name: error
props.description: The error object received in the callback. This is the exception thrown that caused the failure for getting self user media. If received as null, it means that there is no errors.

props.name: success
props.description:
The success object received in the callback. The self user media [MediaStream](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MediaStream_API) object. To display the MediaStream object to a video or audio, simply invoke:
attachMediaStream(domElement, stream);. If received as null, it means that there are errors.

classitems.description:
Replaces the currently attached Stream object in Skylink and refreshes all
  connection with Peer connections to send the updated Stream object.
The application may provide their own MediaStream object to send to
  all PeerConnections connection.
Reference {{#crossLink "Skylink/refreshConnection:method"}}refreshConnection(){{/crossLink}}
   on the events triggered and restart mechanism.
classitems.name: sendStream

params.name: options
params.description: The self Stream streaming settings for the new Stream object to replace the current Stream object attached to Skylink. If this parameter is provided as a MediaStream object, the MediaStream object settings for mediaStatus would be detected as unmuted by default.

props.name: audio
props.description: The self Stream streaming audio settings. If false, it means that audio streaming is disabled in the self Stream. If this option is set to true or is defined with settings, {{#crossLink "Skylink/getUserMedia:method"}}getUserMedia(){{/crossLink}} will be invoked. Self will not connect to the room unless the Stream audio user media access is given.

props.name: stereo
props.description:
The flag that indicates if
  stereo should be enabled in self connection Stream
  audio streaming.

props.name: mute
props.description:
The flag that
  indicates if the self Stream object audio streaming is muted.

props.name: optional
props.description: The optional constraints for audio streaming in self user media Stream object. This follows the optional setting in the MediaStreamConstraints when getUserMedia() is invoked. Tampering this may cause errors in retrieval of self user media Stream object. Refer to this [site for more reference](http://www.sitepoint.com/introduction-getusermedia-api/).

props.name: video
props.description: The self Stream streaming video settings. If false, it means that video streaming is disabled in the self Stream. If this option is set to true or is defined with settings, {{#crossLink "Skylink/getUserMedia:method"}}getUserMedia(){{/crossLink}} will be invoked. Self will not connect to the room unless the Stream video user media access is given.

props.name: mute
props.description:
The flag that
  indicates if the self Stream object video streaming is muted.

props.name: resolution
props.description:
The self Stream streaming video
  resolution settings. Setting the resolution may
  not force set the resolution provided as it depends on the how the
  browser handles the resolution. [Rel: Skylink.VIDEO_RESOLUTION]

props.name: resolution.width
props.description:
The self
  Stream streaming video resolution width.

props.name: resolution.height
props.description:
The self
  Stream streaming video resolution height.

props.name: frameRate
props.description:
The self
  Stream streaming video maximum frameRate.

props.name: optional
props.description: The optional constraints for video streaming in self user media Stream object. This follows the optional setting in the MediaStreamConstraints when getUserMedia() is invoked. Tampering this may cause errors in retrieval of self user media Stream object. Refer to this [site for more reference](http://www.sitepoint.com/introduction-getusermedia-api/).

params.name: callback
params.description: The callback fired after Skylink has replaced the current Stream object successfully with the provided media settings / MediaStream object or have met with an exception. The callback signature is function (error, success).

props.name: error
props.description: The error object received in the callback. This is the exception thrown that caused the failure for replacing the current Stream object. If received as null, it means that there is no errors.

props.name: success
props.description:
The success object received in the callback. The self user media [MediaStream](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MediaStream_API) object. To display the MediaStream object to a video or audio, simply invoke:
attachMediaStream(domElement, stream);. If received as null, it means that there are errors.

classitems.description: Mutes the currently attached Stream object in Skylink.
classitems.name: muteStream

params.name: options
params.description: The self Stream streaming muted settings.

props.name: audioMuted
props.description: The flag that indicates if self connection Stream object audio streaming is muted. If there is no audio streaming enabled for self connection, by default, it is set to true.

props.name: videoMuted
props.description: The flag that indicates if self connection Stream object video streaming is muted. If there is no video streaming enabled for self connection, by default, it is set to true.

classitems.description: Unmutes the currently attached Stream object audio stream.
classitems.name: enableAudio
example: SkylinkDemo.enableAudio();

classitems.description: Mutes the currently attached Stream object audio stream.
classitems.name: disableAudio
example: SkylinkDemo.disableAudio();

classitems.description: Unmutes the currently attached Stream object video stream.
classitems.name: enableVideo
example: SkylinkDemo.enableVideo();

classitems.description: Mutes the currently attached Stream object video stream.
classitems.name: disableVideo
example: SkylinkDemo.disableVideo();

classitems.description: Shares the current screen with Peer connections and will refresh all Peer connections to send the screensharing Stream object with HTTPS protocol accessing application. Reference {{#crossLink "Skylink/refreshConnection:method"}}refreshConnection(){{/crossLink}} on the events triggered and restart mechanism. This will require our own Temasys Skylink extension to do screensharing. For screensharing feature in IE / Safari with our Temasys Plugin, please [contact us](https://www.temasys.com.sg/contact-us). Currently, Opera does not support screensharing feature. This does not replace the currently attached user media Stream object in Skylink.
classitems.name: shareScreen

params.name: enableAudio
params.description: The flag that indicates if self screensharing Stream streaming should have audio. If false, it means that audio streaming is disabled in the remote Stream of self connection.

params.name: callback
params.description: The callback fired after Skylink has shared the screen successfully or have met with an exception. The callback signature is function (error, success).

props.name: error
props.description: The error object received in the callback. This is the exception thrown that caused the failure for sharing the screen. If received as null, it means that there is no errors.

props.name: success
props.description:
The success object received in the callback. The self screensharing [MediaStream](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MediaStream_API) object. To display the MediaStream object to a video or audio, simply invoke:
attachMediaStream(domElement, stream);. If received as null, it means that there are errors.

classitems.trigger: mediaAccessSuccess, mediaAccessError, incomingStream, peerRestart, serverPeerRestart, peerUpdated

classitems.description:
Stops self screensharing Stream object attached to Skylink.
If user media Stream object is available, Skylink will refresh all
   Peer connections to send the user media Stream object.
Reference {{#crossLink "Skylink/refreshConnection:method"}}refreshConnection(){{/crossLink}}
   on the events triggered and restart mechanism.
classitems.name: stopScreen
example: SkylinkDemo.stopScreen();

classitems.description:
Modifies the array of session description received to enable
  stereo in the audio streaming connection.
classitems.name: _addSDPStereo

params.name: sdpLines
params.description: The array of lines in the session description.

return.description:
The updated array of lines in the session description
   with the stereo feature.

classitems.description: BROKEN (not in use). Modifies the array of session description received to set a custom video resolution in the video streaming connection.
classitems.name: _setSDPVideoResolution

params.name: sdpLines
params.description: The array of lines in the session description.

return.description:
The updated array of lines in the session description
   with the custom video resolution.

classitems.description:
Modifies the array of session description received to set
  a custom bandwidth bitrate (in kbps) in the streaming connection.
Setting the bandwidth flags may not
  force set the bandwidth for each connection stream channels as it depends
  on how the browser handles the bandwidth bitrate.
classitems.name: _setSDPBitrate

params.name: sdpLines
params.description: The array of lines in the session description.

return.description:
The updated array of lines in the session description
   with custom bandwidth bitrate (in kbps) settings.

classitems.description:
Modifies the array of session description received to configure
  the selected video codec to use in the video streaming connection.
classitems.name: _setSDPVideoCodec

params.name: sdpLines
params.description: The array of lines in the session description.

return.description:
The updated array of lines in the session description
   with the selected video codec.

classitems.description:
Modifies the array of session description received to configure
  the selected audio codec to use in the audio streaming connection.
classitems.name: _setSDPAudioCodec

params.name: sdpLines
params.description: The array of lines in the session description.

return.description:
The updated array of lines in the session description
   with the selected audio codec.

classitems.description:
Modifies the array of session description received to remove the
  Firefox 32 H262 preference to prevent breaking connection with nsupported browsers.
classitems.name: _removeSDPFirefoxH264Pref

params.name: sdpLines
params.description: The array of lines in the session description.

return.description:
The updated array of lines in the session description
   removed of the Firefox 32 H262 preference.
